tasks: Create a mind map illustrating the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design, highlighting at least 3 key principles and their corresponding benefits (Reference: https://www.nngroup.com/articles/ten-usability-heuristics/).
Write a short reflection (max. 250 words) on how Tesler's Law applies to your current design work, including specific examples of how it has impacted your design decisions.
Develop a simple Aesthetic-Usability Effect experiment using a hypothetical product, outlining the research question, methodology, and expected outcomes.

Conduct a self-assessment exercise on your current collaboration style, identifying areas for improvement and documenting specific strategies you can implement to enhance communication with team members.
Create a visual representation (e.g., infographic or diagram) illustrating the Zeigarnik Effect's impact on user engagement, including its relevance to your current design projects.
Develop a basic prototype of a product feature using a tool like Sketch or Figma, focusing on incorporating the Laws of UX principles you've learned so far.
Design and conduct a usability study on a hypothetical feature, applying the Jobs-to-be-Done framework to identify user pain points and develop solutions.
Create a case study detailing how you applied the Laws of UX principles in a recent design project, highlighting specific successes and areas for improvement.
Develop an advanced Aesthetic-Usability Effect experiment using real-world data, outlining the research question, methodology, and expected outcomes.
Create a comprehensive portfolio piece showcasing your design process, including wireframes, prototypes, and final designs that demonstrate your mastery of Product Thinking & Strategy principles.

Develop an in-depth analysis (max. 500 words) on how you've applied the Laws of UX principles to improve user experience in your current design work, highlighting specific successes and lessons learned.
Design a product roadmap for a hypothetical company, incorporating strategic thinking and collaboration with stakeholders to drive user-centered design decisions.

resources.readup: As a Strategic Lead UX Designer, you have the unique opportunity to drive user-centered design across entire product lines, leveraging your expertise in UX Fundamentals, UI Craft & Visual Design, and User Research & Validation. By combining your skills with strong Product Thinking & Strategy and effective Collaboration & Communication, you can make a lasting impact on the products you touch, delivering exceptional user experiences that exceed expectations.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Jakob's Law and its Impact on Information Architecture
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, understanding how users process information can inform design decisions to improve user experience.
practice_points: Analyze 5 existing websites using Jakob's Law and document the results in a spreadsheet
Create a new website wireframe with clear navigation and typography following Jakob's principles
Conduct an A/B testing experiment to validate Jakob's Law on a specific product feature

topics.name: Applying Tesler’s Law for Consistent Branding
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, mastering Tesler’s Law can ensure consistent branding across all touchpoints, enhancing user trust and loyalty.
practice_points: Create 3 brand style guides with typography, color palette, and spacing tokens using Tesler’s principles
Analyze 5 existing brands that successfully apply Tesler’s Law and document the results in a case study
Design a new product packaging design following Tesler’s guidelines for consistent branding

topics.name: Evaluating the Zeigarnik Effect on User Engagement
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, understanding how to leverage the Zeigarnik Effect can increase user engagement and retention.
practice_points: Conduct 2 usability testing sessions with participants who have been left with an unresolved task or question
Analyze existing products that successfully apply the Zeigarnik Effect and document the results in a report
Design a new product feature that incorporates the Zeigarnik Effect to increase user engagement
